article: Mr. Smith liked his job. He liked his town, and he didn't like the idea of moving somewhere else, but his wife _ telling him that his pay was not enough to _ the needs of the family. That was why he was thinking of taking a new job in Boston, _ he had been offered a job in a factory, and the pay was far _ . Henry Manley, boss of Mr. Smith, was the _ of a small company making computers. The company was in _ trouble, because among other reasons, the Japanese were selling such things at very _ prices. As a result, Manley had to _ his own price and profits as well, otherwise he would not get any orders at all. Even so, orders were _ not coming in fast enough, so that there was no money for raises for his workers. Somehow, he had to struggle along and keep his _ workers as well. He sighed . _ then the telephone rang. His secretary told him that Mr. Smith wanted to _ him as soon as possible. Manley sighed again. He could _ what it was about. Mr. Smith was a very young engineer. The company had no _ unless it could attract men like him. Manley rubbed his forehead: his _ seemed endless.
